tags: lady sif and the warriors three
summary:
Why does no one talk about that once scene in the first Thor movie? The one right before the battle scene?
Thor had accepted...
body:
Why does no one talk about that once scene in the first Thor movie? The one right before the battle scene?

Thor had accepted life on earth and was learning to cook. He was prepared to stay there with Jane, Darcy, and Erik indefinitely, and he was actually kind of liking it. And I’ll say it again: HE WAS LEARNING TO COOK.

And then when the Lady Sif and the Warriors Three show up, they are literally pressed against the glass, smiling and waving at him. Adorable.

So seriously, why does no one talk about this scene?

Thor had accepted life on earth and was learning to cook. He was prepared to stay there with Jane, Darcy, and Erik indefinitely, and he was actually kind of liking it. And I’ll say it again: HE WAS LEARNING TO COOK.

And then when the Lady Sif and the Warriors Three show up, they are literally pressed against the glass, smiling and waving at him. Adorable.

So seriously, why does no one talk about this scene?

summary: Fan has seen Avengers: Endgame 116 times in quest for world record
title: Fan has seen Avengers: Endgame 116 times in quest for world record
body:
Fan has seen Avengers: Endgame 116 times in quest for world record

Did you endure Avengers: Endgame ‘s three-hour runtime without a restroom break? Bravo! However, as of Thursday night, Agustin Alanis, 30, of Riverview, Florida has endured that blockbuster film’s three-hour runtime multiple times. Not even once has he dodged out for a break, despite the fact that he definitely knows when the more skippable scenes come up.

Alanis is gunning for the Guinness…

View On WordPress

summary: sorry but bucky knew exactly what steve was going to do. he’s his best friend how could he not know exactly what steve was...
body:
sorry but bucky knew exactly what steve was going to do. he’s his best friend how could he not know exactly what steve was thinking from the MOMENT they got the particles that made it possible to TRAVEL BACK IN TIME? the man out of time? the man who had seventy years stolen right out from under him? you telling me bucky really was so surprised when steve took the opportunity to live the life that was denied him? you telling me that bucky really told steve “i’m gonna miss you” because he thought he was going to see him in the next five seconds? you really think that “don’t do anything stupid until i get back” comment was met with “how can i you’re taking all the stupid with you” was JUST for nostalgia’s sake? JUST for the sake of their long friendship? that the look on his face as he said it WASN’T because they’d discussed it and weighed the pros and cons, bucky eventually throwing up his hands and saying “fine man you do you go do it go live your best life” because he knew damn good and well why steve wanted to do it in the first place?? because he is ALSO the man out of time??

you REALLY think he didn’t know??

cmon.

you REALLY think he didn’t know??

cmon.

summary: i forgot i started a steve endgame one shot so here’s a lil preview to give me motivation to finish
title: i forgot i started a steve endgame one shot so here’s a lil preview to give me motivation to finish
body:
Steve didn’t consciously make the decision to go back.

When he left behind his friends in 2023, he knew his mission.  Return the infinity stones to the realities they had taken them from, and then come back to his timeline.  To where he belonged.  If he did everything right, only five seconds would pass before he returned to Bruce, Bucky, and Sam.  They would only have to miss him for five seconds.

Steve’s mission was as by the book as a mission to travel through time to return magical stones could be. He traveled to New York in 2012, to Asgard in 2013, and Morag in 2014.  There was a slight hitch in his plan when he went to Vormir; the last person he expected to see was Red Skull.  But still, he was a soldier, and he knew how to carry out his duties.  He did what was expected of him.

And then it came time to return the Tesseract to New Jersey in 1970.

Steve consciously left this stone last, almost like a reward to himself.  If he did his job right, if he succeeded in his mission, then he would get to see her one last time.  Peggy. His best girl.

Returning the Tesseract to where Tony had taken it from was easy.  Getting a glimpse of Peggy, and not being able to speak to her…that was devastatingly hard.

But a mission was a mission, and Steve had completed his tasks.  He had one more sample of Pym Particles, enough to get him through one more trip.  It was time for him to go back home.  To go back to where he belonged.

Home.  Where he belonged.  Those were the thoughts running through Steve’s head as he stepped back into the Quantum Realm.  The place where he was meant to be.  Home. Where he belonged.  Home.

When Steve exited the Quantum Realm, he was standing on the corner of Plymouth Street, about a block away from his 1930s apartment.

summary: Everyone talks about Marvel being the company about hope but the fact that they have decided that two heroic souls are trapped...
body: Everyone talks about Marvel being the company about hope but the fact that they have decided that two heroic souls are trapped for eternity (the versions in the upcoming movies are AU / Alternate timelines), that means they have done something far darker than anything DC has ever done. At least DC hasn’t damned the innocent or heroic in its film universe.

reblog.comment: Everyone talks about Marvel being the company about hope but the fact that they have decided that two heroic souls are trapped for eternity (the versions in the upcoming movies are AU / Alternate timelines), that means they have done something far darker than anything DC has ever done. At least DC hasn’t damned the innocent or heroic in its film universe.

tags: but i needed to talk about this
sorry if i missed any tags
summary: i just want to take a minute to appreciate the moments directly following Tony’s death. so much of the time after a major...
body:
i just want to take a minute to appreciate the moments directly following Tony’s death.

so much of the time after a major emotional moment, movies have this tendency to immediately divert your attention, something explodes, the music swells, somebody screams in anguish, shakes their fist at the unforgiving sky, because whoa this is too much Feelings™ we need a distraction STAT

and it’s just so much NOISE

but they didn’t do that here

instead

they did exactly what we all needed

they literally gave us a moment of silence

to fully understand the magnitude of what just happened

but also to respect Tony’s incredible sacrifice

let there be a quiet moment

let there be time to feel the pain

because we just lost not only one of the founding members of the Avengers

the one who got the ball rolling and KEPT it rolling all those years

but a selfless brave man who just after he’d gotten everything he ever wanted

gave it all up to save the world

that silence

was incredibly necessary

and i am so thankful

that they gave it to us

when all the precedents said they wouldn’t

reblog.comment:
i just want to take a minute to appreciate the moments directly following Tony’s death.

so much of the time after a major emotional moment, movies have this tendency to immediately divert your attention, something explodes, the music swells, somebody screams in anguish, shakes their fist at the unforgiving sky, because whoa this is too much Feelings™ we need a distraction STAT

and it’s just so much NOISE

but they didn’t do that here

instead

they did exactly what we all needed

they literally gave us a moment of silence

to fully understand the magnitude of what just happened

but also to respect Tony’s incredible sacrifice

let there be a quiet moment

let there be time to feel the pain

because we just lost not only one of the founding members of the Avengers

the one who got the ball rolling and KEPT it rolling all those years

but a selfless brave man who just after he’d gotten everything he ever wanted

gave it all up to save the world

that silence

was incredibly necessary

and i am so thankful

that they gave it to us

when all the precedents said they wouldn’t

blog.name: warmhappycat
blog.title: Can't Make Any Promises
blog.description:
I don't know what I'm doing here.

If I ever reblog an image of your cat (or any cat) with what sounds like sarcastic ridicule, know that I am 100% earnest. I love that cat.

Pronouns: she/her/hers

tags: i will die mad about this
summary: On the one hand Endgame is just a movie, but on the other hand I sent someone 22 messages about it in the middle of the night,...
body: On the one hand Endgame is just a movie, but on the other hand I sent someone 22 messages about it in the middle of the night, so maybe it fucked me up a little.
